instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used to assist physicians in tumor detection by analyzing the ratios of Choline (Cho), creatine (Cr), and N-Acetyl Aspartate (Naa) metabolites?

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the classification performance to assist physicians in tumor detection by analyzing the ratios of Choline (Cho), creatine (Cr), and N-Acetyl Aspartate (Naa) metabolites and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the classification performance of the CAD system in past study was accuracy. instruction: What machine learning models were used in the CAD system to assist physicians in tumor detection through MR spectroscopy?
Output: The machine learning models used in the CAD system to assist physicians in tumor detection through MR spectroscopy were K-Nearest Neighborhood (KEYK), Support Vector Machine (SVM), Decision Trees (DT), and Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) based deep learning method.

instruction: How does the classification performance of the deep learning method based on LSTM compare to the classical methods (KEYK, SVM, and DT) in the CAD system developed for tumor detection through MR spectroscopy?
Output: The classification performance of the deep learning method based on LSTM is higher than the classical methods (KEYK, SVM, and DT) in the CAD system developed for tumor detection through MR spectroscopy. The deep learning method achieved a classification performance of 93%, while the classical methods achieved around 83 +/- 6.36%. This indicates that the deep learning method outperformed the classical methods in classifying MRS data and can be used effectively in a CAD system to assist experts in the decision-making process for tumor detection.
